body:
### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.8.0 release

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

not sure, might be N/A

### Operating system/version

Arch Linux

### Terminal name/version

xterm (374)

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

system package manager

### How to reproduce the issue

1. Using the following vimrc:
```
lua <<EOF
local buffer = vim.api.nvim_create_buf(false, false)
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_option(buffer, "buftype", "nofile")

local lines = {'a', 'b'}   -- seems to only happen when #lines >= 2
local timer = vim.loop.new_timer()
timer:start(0, 100, vim.schedule_wrap(function()
    vim.pretty_print(vim.fn.getbufinfo())
    vim.api.nvim_buf_set_lines(buffer, 0, -1, false, lines)
end))
EOF
```
2. Run `nvim --clean -u /path/to/vimrc`
3. Quit nvim (I seem to get error more often when using `ZZ` or `ZQ`).

In actual usage, I'm getting this from the interaction of two plugins (https://github.com/nvim-zh/colorful-winsep.nvim and https://github.com/rhysd/committia.vim), and I'm including those steps in here for reference:
1. Download/git clone the following plugins: 
    * https://github.com/nvim-zh/colorful-winsep.nvim
    * https://github.com/rhysd/committia.vim
1. Make the following vimrc:
```
set runtimepath+=/path/to/colorful-winsep.nvim
set runtimepath+=/path/to/committia.vim
let g:committia_min_window_width = &columns / 2
lua require('colorful-winsep').setup{}
```
1. Inside any git repo, run `GIT_EDITOR='nvim --clean -u /path/to/above/vimrc' git commit`
1. Quit nvim by typing `ZQ`

### Expected behavior

No error is printed.

### Actual behavior

About 50% of the time, the following error is printed back to the terminal after the nvim tui has exited
```
{ {    bufnr = 1,    changed = 0,    changedtick = -1,    hidden = 0,    lastused = 1669270126,    linecount = 1,    listed = 1,    lnum = 1,    loaded = 0,    name = "",    variables = {      changedtick = -1    },    windows = { 1000 }  }, {    bufnr = 2,    changed = 0,    changedtick = 5,    hidden = 0,    lastused = 0,    linecount = 2,    listed = 0,    lnum = 0,    loaded = 0,    name = "",    variables = {      changedtick = 5    },    windows = {}  } }
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: [string ":lua"]:8: Vim:E322: line number out of range: 1 past the end
stack traceback:
	[C]: in function 'nvim_buf_set_lines'
	[string ":lua"]:8: in function ''
	vim/_editor.lua: in function <vim/_editor.lua:0>
```

I don't think this causing any adverse functional impact, i.e. nvim still works, it just prints this error as well.
title: (Vim:E322: line number out of range: 1 past the end) with nvim_buf_set_lines
